page.title: 11HOUSING BILLINGSHURST
page.content: MOST HOUSING IS IN THE VILLAGE ITSELF. OUTLYING HOUSING IS MAINLY FARMHOUSES, TIED COTTAGES, CONVERTED FARMHOUSES OR RESTORED COTTAGES. EXAMPLES OF DOMESTIC ARCHITECTURE EXIST FROM MEDIEVAL TO PRESENT DAY BUT MOST DEVELOPMENT HAS TAKEN PLACE IN THE LAST 20 YEARS WITH FARMLAND, OPEN SPACES AND GROUNDS OF LARGE HOUSES BUILT UPON. THE MAJORITY OF HOUSES ARE PRIVATELY OWNED INCLUDING SOME EX-HORSHAM COUNCIL HOUSES AND ARE CONCENTRATED AROUND ROWAN DRIVE WITH A SMALLER DEVELOPMENT AT ROSEHILL. ONE LAST OPEN SPACE, HOBSONS FIELD HAS PLANNING CONSENT BUT REMAINS UNDEVELOPED. A BYPASS MIGHT BRING FURTHER DEVELOPMENT. THERE ARE NO LARGE BLOCKS OF FLATS, NOR SLUMS.
